result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack Henry Blank

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jack Henry Blank appeared by video from Dodge County Detention Facility and by Attorney Michael H. Kopp via video.  Defendant is on a probation hold awaiting an ATR.  Court has colloquy with defendant regarding right to be physically present at today's hearing and accepts consent to use of video conferencing.  Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Defendant's probation agent is currently looking for residential options.  Atty. Kopp anticipates resolution and requests an adjournment to December or January for a plea and sentencing.  State has no objection to an adjournment.  Counsel and defendant to appear via zoom video at next court appearance and counsel to advise the Court as to where defendant is incarcerated.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Zoom appearance granted for defendant for 10-21-2022 hearing.

Defendant Jack Henry Blank not in court.  Attorney Michael H. Kopp appeared by video for Jack Henry Blank.  Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is located at Dodge County Detention Center and wasn't able to be produced. Counsel requests special time as believes case will resolve w/ free to argue sentence. State to prepare an OTP.
Arraignment scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Elizabeth A. Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Michael Kopp appears on behalf of defendant.  Defendant is currently on probation for a Washington County case and a Dodge County case.  Per Atty. Kopp, defendant was unable to find a ride to Court today and is in contact with his probation officer.  Defendant Jack Blank now appears via phone. Court will adjourn arraignment.  Counsel to file notice of retainer.  Arraignment scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Allison E. Cogbill in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jack Henry Blank in court and by Atty. Michael Kopp.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Counsel informs the Court that he may be running late for the calendar on July 25th and Court notes.  Arraignment scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Prosecuting Attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jack Henry Blank in court and by Atty. Michael Kopp.  Counsel's first appearance.  Waiver of time limits continued.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  No appearance by defendant.  Case called upon State's request.  State informs the Court that the defendant is currently hospitalized and State requests to modify bond to a signature bond.  State informs the Court that the bond would be transported to the hospital for defendant's signature via the Sheriff's Department and returned to Clerk of Courts.  Court denies request to modify bail.
No contact with JFR; Maintain absolute sobriety; Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jack Henry Blank appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Wilfred P. de Junco, as a friend of the court, for Jack Henry Blank appeared in court.  (Dodge Co. 21CF338)  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney-Michael Kopp and Atty. de Junco spoke with Atty. Kopp who will represent the defendant.  State requests minimum of $3,000.00 cash bond. Atty. de Junco states the defendant is on a PO hold and requests a signature bond.  Court orders $7,500.00 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived.   Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney and for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
